# VS Code Workspace Configuration

> ⚠️ **IMPORTANT: Extension Installation Notice**
>
> When you open this project, VS Code will prompt you to install recommended extensions.
> **These are optional** - the labs work without them, but they enhance your experience.
>
> Review the list before installing:
> - Some extensions collect telemetry
> - Some require additional setup (e.g., Docker)
> - Install only what you need

## Recommended Extensions

| Extension | Purpose | Required? |
|-----------|---------|-----------|
| Python | Python language support | ✅ Recommended |
| Pylance | Type checking & IntelliSense | ✅ Recommended |
| Black Formatter | Code formatting | Optional |
| Jupyter | Notebook support | ✅ For notebooks |
| YARA | YARA rule syntax | Optional |
| GitLens | Git history & blame | Optional |
| Error Lens | Inline error display | Optional |

## Cursor Users

If you're using **Cursor IDE**, most Python extensions are built-in.
You may want to skip installing duplicates.

## Disabling Recommendations

To stop VS Code from prompting:
1. Click "Don't Show Again" when prompted
2. Or add to your user settings:
   ```json
   "extensions.ignoreRecommendations": true
   ```
